meanings.definition: To remove the classification from (information, a document, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The government declassifies old documents for historians to study.
meanings.sent2: The agency declassifies sensitive information after a certain period.
meanings.sent3: The librarian accidentally declassifies the wrong file, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity declassifies the hidden truth, revealing a shocking secret.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight declassifies the faded ink, making the text legible again.

meanings.definition: To make (information, a document, etc.) no longer classified.
meanings.sent1: The committee declassifies the report for public access.
meanings.sent2: The archivist declassifies the confidential files for research purposes.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocks over the cabinet and accidentally declassifies the top-secret documents.
meanings.sent4: His persuasive argument declassifies the guarded information, opening up new possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The rainwater slowly declassifies the ink, blurring the once classified text.
